CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Product Range relative to the peak of Delivery Speed in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Product Range is to the {right} of the peak of Delivery Speed.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Personalization show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Personalization shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Loyalty Programs reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Customer Support} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =26.8?
EVJ.A: At X =26.8,the label with the highest density is {Loyalty Programs}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 52? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Delivery Speed}'s peak at {78},{Product Range}'s peak at {83},{Return Policies}'s peak at {83}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 41? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Loyalty Programs}'s peak at {16},{Customer Support}'s peak at {11},{Personalization}'s peak at {10}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Loyalty Programs or Customer Support?
NC.A: {Loyalty Programs} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Product Range or Personalization?
NC.A: {Product Range} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {3} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Customer Support}
